name: places/ChIJD_5YPbxYwokRxgW2AyWBeO0
formattedAddress: 177 E 87th St #501, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 177 E 87th St #501, New York, NY 10128-2226, USA

originalText.text:
READ THIS!!! LCLemle is borderline criminal. There are safety hazards they ignore and they gaslight their Tennant’s when they raise concerns. 505 E 88th Street is poorly maintained, incredibly dirty, infested with rats, and smells like sewage. The management doesn’t care.

We had a gas leak in our apartment (that maintenance ignored for weeks until it was flagged by ConEd) and LCLemle put their lawyer on us to tell us we were wrong and fabricating the situation.

Mediocre NYC landlords are very common, but LCLemle is purposefully negligent and will be glad to take your money while they knowingly let you live in danger.

originalText.text: They do not run in the heat in any of their buildings. I have complained several times about the temperature of my apartment - which at this point, I'm not even sure is legal. Management tries to save money on heat at the expense of renters and its extremely frustrating.

text.text: They do not run in the heat in any of their buildings. I have complained several times about the temperature of my apartment - which at this point, I'm not even sure is legal. Management tries to save money on heat at the expense of renters and its extremely frustrating.

originalText.text: I’ve been leasing with LC Lemle for 3 years and would rate my experience as exceptional.  The staff is responsive, polite, and understanding.  They worked with me and treated me with respect through some difficult months for me personally during the Covid-19 shutdown. They have always communicated with me clearly and delivered high quality apartments.  I appreciate them very much and highly recommend them as a landlord.

text.text: I’ve been leasing with LC Lemle for 3 years and would rate my experience as exceptional.  The staff is responsive, polite, and understanding.  They worked with me and treated me with respect through some difficult months for me personally during the Covid-19 shutdown. They have always communicated with me clearly and delivered high quality apartments.  I appreciate them very much and highly recommend them as a landlord.

originalText.text: I lived in an LC building on the UES for a year - based on experiences with other landlords/property managers I think they are fair and polite. Granted it's NYC so nothing is perfect, but they are responsive and the building was well-maintained and comfortable...was rare I had to reach out to them at all or maintenance. Overall I would rent from them again and everyone in the office was very kind whenever I came by.

text.text: I lived in an LC building on the UES for a year - based on experiences with other landlords/property managers I think they are fair and polite. Granted it's NYC so nothing is perfect, but they are responsive and the building was well-maintained and comfortable...was rare I had to reach out to them at all or maintenance. Overall I would rent from them again and everyone in the office was very kind whenever I came by.

originalText.text:
We were former residents at a Lemle building in the upper east side last year for 2 years. We had the option of renewing our lease during Covid and the office was extremely responsive and was willing to work with us. As to the unit itself, the building was dated, but LC Lemle had an online service to make a maintenance request. The super cleaned the building every day and overall the properties were well kept and affordable. We also appreciate that they have many buildings on the UES and are willing to work with you to transfer to another unit when your lease is up.

Highly recommended based on our experience.
